{{Disambig-two|the poem|[[Sprites|half-fay]] in the early [[legendarium]]|[[Tinfang Warble]]}}
'''Tinfang Warble''' is a poem written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in [[1914]] and can be found in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales: Part One]]''.<ref>{{LT1|Tinfang}}, p. 108</ref> The original version was written at [[Oxford]] in 1914 and it was rewritten at [[Leeds]] in 1920-23. In [[1927]] it was published in a further altered form which can be seen below. 

==Poem excerpt==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">O the hoot! O the hoot!
How he trillups on his flute!
O the hoot of Tinfang Warble!</poem>

In the earliest version, Tinfang is called a 'leprawn', and in the Gnomish speech he is a 'fay'.
